meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be an amateur in a particular activity.
meanings.sent1: The shamateurs at the talent show tried to fool the judges with their fake skills.
meanings.sent2: She uncovered the shamateurs in the art class who claimed they couldn't draw.
meanings.sent3: The group of shamateurs in the cooking competition accidentally used salt instead of sugar!
meanings.sent4: The shamateurs in the music band were like actors on a stage, playing their parts.
meanings.sent5: The town's annual festival was full of shamateurs trying to pass as skilled artisans.

meanings.definition: To pretend to be an amateur in a particular activity.
meanings.sent1: He decided to shamateurs his way through the dance class to avoid embarrassment.
meanings.sent2: They always shamateurs their lack of knowledge to get out of doing chores.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it would be funny to shamateurs their way into the advanced class.
meanings.sent4: She had to shamateurs her interest in sports to fit in with her new friends.
meanings.sent5: The actor had to shamateurs his fear of heights for the movie scene.
